name: UpdateRuleset
description:
Update an existing ruleset in PagerDuty.

Use this tool to update a ruleset in PagerDuty, which routes events to endpoints and defines actions based on event content. Note: Rulesets are being phased out, and migration to Event Orchestration is recommended. Requires `event_rules.write` OAuth scope.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the ruleset to be updated.

parameters.name: accept_version_header
parameters.description: String specifying the API version for the Accept header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the media type of the request body, must be 'application/json'.

parameters.name: ruleset_update_data
parameters.description: The JSON object containing details of the ruleset to be updated, including ID, type, name, routing keys, creator, and more.

self.description: the API show URL at which the object is accessible

routing_keys.description: Routing keys routed to this Ruleset.

created_at.description: The date the Ruleset was created at.

type.description: A string that determines the schema of the object

self.description: The API show URL at which the object is accessible

creator.description: Reference to the user that has created the Ruleset.

updated_at.description: The date the Ruleset was last updated.

type.description: A string that determines the schema of the object

self.description: The API show URL at which the object is accessible

updater.description: Reference to the user that has updated the Ruleset last.

type.description: A string that determines the schema of the object

self.description: The API show URL at which the object is accessible

team.description: Reference to the team that owns the Ruleset. If none is specified, only admins have access.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.
